description: When returning to the home page, you're now taken to either the home page or the featured page; whichever you were last on.
The footer page 'terms and conditions' has been replaced with a more sensible 'about' page featuring more useful information.
When loading up the website, you are greeted to an animated welcome, then taken to a 'Featured Projects' page. This is the new home page, and from here you can navigate to the old home page.
Added link to new Etsy store in the 'Miscellaneous' section. Also, generalised the 'artworks' page by ranaming it to the 'instagram posts' page.
Removed functionality for the old version website, which could previously be accessed from the 'Miscellaneous' section. It was inevitable.

As promised, the portfolio articles are finished and on the website. Click on a project's button to read them. This is also available for the unreleased Canvas Castle game. I've also brought back the Carli & Co. website, just without its dynamic code. And the project 'Horse' has been removed from the website.

Using a live server, I can now write code that ordinarily only works with HTTPs including cookies and fetch requests. Using this, a cookie bug was fixed so that every page on the site remembers the colour theme. Also, most data is now stored as JSON files for ease.

Swapped foreground and background colours, removed gradient background, adjusted dark mode. Colours are now stored differently and in a more adaptable manner. Also, other small visual changes on Home page & Documents page.

Added a feature called 'Portfolio', where you can read information about many projects. Content is not yet available, but button present for select projects. Additionally, Carli&Co and BookABench are no longer accessible due to hosting difficulties. Hopefully this is temporary.
Website has been migrated from jaimatthews.cf to JaiMatthews.com. Minor visual changes to Change Log.
Added an article editor to 'Miscellaneous' section for creating new written items using Quill API. This will be used when adding items to 'writing' section. Changed some home page images.
Footer CSS has be redone to ensure items remain in the centre despite Dark Mode toggle. On small screens, Dark Mode toggle now appears beneath other footer items & footer items are better laid out.
Illustrations page now has better hover effects & shows entry numbers. It also uses the Instagram Display API to fetch all illustrations from my instagram account.

A number of visual bugs have been resolved on the main menu, a number of older projects have been added to Documents portal, some website text altered, and placeholder for 'Untitled Game' added to 'Toys & Games' section.

Re-added dark mode to the website. Just use the toggle in the footer. In addition, it uses a far more elegant system than the last website; cookies! The website now has cookies. This has been added to the TOS.

Added a 'documents' page in the Misc. section. It features a couple of spreadsheets, and a simple speedrunning tool I made a few months ago. Essentially, it's a portal to things that wouldn't usually be made publicly available, but would still be put on the website. It's there for the sake of convenience.
Year 12 Computer Science Major Project has been added to website. 'Gravity' is a physics simulation running in JavaScript.

I have fixed some typos, adjusted some imagery & icons, and added many animations. The home page now has an animated pop-up that appears before you view a project. Finally, the home page (and changelog) stores information in javascript objects, making it simpler to edit & ammend them future.
Two written pieces have been added to my website in the 'writing' section; Evil Villain & Women in Video Games. Both of these are school projects and are now available online.

Website has been re-done from the ground up. You can now navigate projects based on category on home page. Illustrations & Mystery Night pages have been moved to projects accessible from the home page. About page removed, but most of its features are available in the footer. Added new project; 'Balls' available in 'Toys and Games' section. The website is now mobile compatible.
Added new button to launchpad, which is locked at present. Added final date to countdown menu positioned at bottom right.
Following popular request, the website can be viewed as it was prior to the re-design. Scroll down and click 'View Legacy Website'.
Fixed slight mathematical error in countdown website. Added 2 new in-built countdowns.
Added website for The JaiRell Experience.
New website: Countdown generator. Can be used to generate a countdown to any date which is toggleable between minutes & days. Tears of the Kingdom coutdown is in-built.
Navbar hover effects have been changed, website now uses different shade of blue (or green - it's not important - shut up), website now runs in light mode rather than dark mode.

Mystery Night has it's own website, MN1 & MN2 can now be played on it. Resources for MN1 and MN2 can be downloaded. Mystery Night 4 page available. Book-A-Bench website is now available. Placeholder for future project added to header. About page drastically changed.
Today the new Jai Matthews Website was offiially launched featuring links to other sites, Illustrations, Mystery Nights and more!
One of my 2022 Computer Science assignments, The Password Company, was added to the website at jaimatthews.cf/tpc.
A link to Carli & Co.'s website was added. Unfortunately the site could not be hosted on jaimatthews.cf like other assignments.
A series of plans were laid out for a new version of the website featuring my Illustrations and other projects.
jaimatthews.cf was created to host all my assignments that are in the form of a website. The site is hosted on GitHub.
